programme.title: Facing Waves
programme.desc: Luke Hopkins and Anne Pagano explore one of the world’s great water trails by stand up paddle board - Florida’s Great Calusa Blueway Paddling Trail.

programme.title: Facing Waves
programme.desc: Luke Hopkins and Alex Kellar explore the rugged Oregon Coast by sea kayak, SUP and whitewater kayak.

programme.title: Facing Waves
programme.desc: Ken Whiting explores the beautiful rivers of North Carolina by sea kayak and inflatable kayak.

programme.title: Facing Waves
programme.sub-title: Paddling Creeks and Coves in the Southeast
programme.desc: Ken Whiting tackles whitewater in North Carolina before heading to the renowned Guntersville Lake in Alabama.

programme.title: USA Through the Great Outdoors
programme.desc: Place is inextricably linked to who we are as human beings. See the American Great Outdoors in its purest and most authentic light – through the eyes of locals.

programme.title: Facing Waves
programme.desc: Ken Whiting travels to Juneau, Alaska to paddle with whales, bears, glaciers and icebergs on a multi-day sea kayaking adventure.

programme.title: Four Corners
programme.desc: Today, Jamie is up with his surprise itinerary in Arizona - taking in the Grand Canyon, Tucson, Tombstone and many other adventures in between... But how will the trip go down with the others?!

programme.title: Four Corners
programme.desc: For this episode, Ben’s planned an EPIC 48 hours in Utah, starting in Salt Lake City before venturing down to Zion National Park - but what will the other guys make of his itinerary?

programme.title: Q: Alabama’s Barbecue Legends
programme.desc: The story of Alabama barbecue can’t be told in sentences. It’s told through whiffs of smoke, buckets of sauce and friendly nods across the counter. See how a simple dish has become a culinary anthem for Alabama.

programme.title: Roadfood Adventures USA
programme.desc: Travel along the West to some of the most colorful roads, delicious food, magnificent scenery, magic moments, and fascinating people all along the way.

programme.title: Venturing Out: St. Croix
programme.desc: Adventurer and filmmaker Creighton is joined by co-host and local Olivia who challenges him to step out of his comfort zones in surprising ways.

programme.title: Venturing Out: St. Croix
programme.desc: Captain Johnny Carson joins Creighton for a high-seas adventure, leading them on a wild chase through the brush and bramble of St. Croix's famous Buck Island.

programme.title: United States of Sports
programme.desc: Copa90’s Eli and Timbsy and Love Island’s Josh Denzel go on a once-in-a-lifetime road trip. Then, the guys hit the Midwest for an unforgettable road trip through Detroit, Chicago and Cincinnati.

programme.title: It All Begins With A Song
programme.desc: A film about one of the most important and unknown forces in music: The Nashville Songwriter. With over 50 masters: Ben Folds, Garth Brooks, Brad Paisley, Luke Bryan, Rodney Crowell, Kacey Musgraves, John Hiatt, Keb Mo, Liz Rose, Claude Kelly and more!

programme.title: USA Through Film 3
programme.desc: American cities have long played a starring role in its cinema. Notable actors and directors, including Hilary Swank, Helen Hunt, and Colman Domingo, tell stories about their favorite U.S. cities.

programme.title: Beach Battles
programme.desc: Dive into the fun blowing conchs in Key West, Florida and race pro SUPS in Wrightsville Beach, North Carolina.

programme.title: Beach Battles
programme.desc: Coney Island, New York hosts its annual Mermaid Parade, and sand sculpting pros battle in Manitowoc, Wisconsin.

programme.title: Beach Battles
programme.sub-title: Beach Battles: Winchester Bay & Long Beach
programme.desc: High-octane dune racing in Winchester Bay, Oregon, plus high-flying Kitefest fun in Long Beach, Washington.

programme.title: Beach Battles
programme.desc: Paddle into Dog Surfing in Pacifica, California, and get picking at the Crab Derby in Crisfield, Maryland.

programme.title: Get Out of Town
programme.desc: Jaunt through Zion National Park.

programme.title: Get Out of Town
programme.sub-title: Beyond The Big Apple - New York, New York
programme.desc: From vintage planes to miniature trains, adventure comes in all sizes, just a short drive from New York City.

programme.title: Get Out of Town
programme.sub-title: Sunshine State of Mind - Orlando, Florida
programme.desc: Orlando can be a gateway to all sorts of surprising adventures.

programme.title: Get Out of Town
programme.sub-title: From the Valley to the Mountains - Los Angeles, California
programme.desc: Relive the golden age of Hollywood.

programme.title: Epic Trails
programme.desc: Eric explores Utah’s breathtaking slot canyons on a multi-day backpacking adventure.

programme.title: Epic Trails
programme.desc: Eric travels to the mountain towns of Durango and Telluride, Colorado to explore the backcountry by ski, snowshoe, and ice axe.

programme.title: Into America's Wild
programme.desc: Step off the beaten path and connect to your inner trailblazer in this cross-country journey to some of the most beautiful but little-known landscapes of North America. Into America’s Wild is a non-stop ride via kayak, train, bike, hot air balloon and more that explores the transformational allure of wild places and the human connection we all share with the natural world.

programme.title: Soul of The South
programme.desc: Join writer and photographer Johny Pitts as he journeys along the Civil Rights Trail through the American South. From Tennessee to Mississippi to Alabama, discover the people and the places, the music, food, and culture, linked to this pivotal period in world history.

programme.title: Small Town, Big Story
programme.desc: We bring our imagination to life and sculpt a turtle-themed masterpiece at America's biggest native sand sculpture competition.

programme.title: Epic Trails
programme.desc: Eric treks the canyons and waters of Lake Powell, Utah on foot and via packraft.

programme.title: Epic Trails
programme.desc: Eric leaves the backcountry to discover urban hiking adventures in the cities of Los Angeles and San Francisco, California.

programme.title: Americanos
programme.desc: Explore how Latinx culture brings American cities to life, through the stories of those who embrace their roots and shape the future.

programme.title: California Pop
programme.desc: Road trip across California to experience the quirky, undiscovered, pop culture landmarks of the USA’s road trip capital.

programme.title: Lucky in Love
programme.desc: Mexican couple Gaby and Miguel embark on a journey of discovery, luck and love in sunny San Diego.

programme.title: Beach Battles
programme.desc: Coney Island, New York hosts its annual Mermaid Parade, and sand sculpting pros battle in Manitowoc, Wisconsin.

programme.title: Beach Battles
programme.desc: Paddle into Dog Surfing in Pacifica, California, and get picking at the Crab Derby in Crisfield, Maryland.

programme.title: Just Landed
programme.desc: Jim kicks off his journey in Virginia Beach, a coastal gem with a deep-rooted fishing heritage. But Mother Nature has her own plans—as storm clouds roll in, Jim has a challenge ahead: tagging his first Redfish for NOAA to help track its migration.

programme.title: Destination Route 66: Roadside Attractions
programme.desc: Route 66 is lined with wonderful and informative attractions. Here are just a few of those must-see stops!

programme.title: Destination Route 66: Great Stays
programme.desc: Rest your head after a long day driving Route 66. Check in to these great accommodations along the way!

programme.title: Small Town, Big Story
programme.desc: One day each year in Fayetteville, West Virginia, scores of people throw caution to the wind and jump off a 876' bridge into the Gorge below.

programme.title: American Beats
programme.sub-title: American Beats: Sea Songs of the Great Lakes
programme.desc: Chunz and Makh embark on a fun-filled voyage through The Upper Peninsula of Michigan to experience the Sea Songs of the Great Lakes. Adventure is abound as they trek through lush forests, stunning waterfalls and even explore a historic shipwreck. Along the way, they meet folk legends Dan Truckey and Lee Murdock, who introduce them to the captivating world of sailors’ tunes. From Lake Ballads to Sea Shanties, their journey culminates at the treasured Hiawatha Folk Festival, where campfire songs and communal vibes celebrate the region's enduring charm.

programme.title: American Beats
programme.desc: Known as the quintessential party music, Polka is alive and evolving in the great city of Milwaukee. At the beloved festival of Germanfest, Polka Hall of Fame legend Peggy Mueller showcases her traditional roots while The November Criminals share their fusion of polka and hip-hop, making it clear there is something for everyone. From buttonboxes to beers and brats, this is a city full of personality and a deep love for its musical heritage.

programme.title: American Beats
programme.desc: Chunz and Makh visit Lafayette, Louisiana where they take a deep dive into Zydeco music and local crawfish with Grammy-winning musician Chubby.

programme.title: Amplify: USVI
programme.sub-title: Amplify USVI: Sound of Revolution: Music as a Voice for Change
programme.desc: Host Naydyeyah Acoy-Thomas uncovers the revolutionary spirit woven into the music of St. Croix, where sound has long served as a rallying cry for justice and identity. Through the powerful perspectives of Mada Nile, Ras Attitude, Ras Bach, the Ay-Ay Cultural Dancers, and Kevin Williams, this episode explores how artists have used music to confront oppression, celebrate resilience, and inspire change — from the island’s historic struggles to its modern-day movements.

programme.title: Amplify: USVI
programme.sub-title: Amplify USVI: Roots & Rhythms: The Foundations of St. Croix Music
programme.desc: Host Naydyeyah Acoy-Thomas traces the rich, layered history of St. Croix’s musical roots, uncovering the deep ties to African, European, and indigenous Taíno traditions. Featuring voices like Asta Williams, Willard John, Rashidi Clenance, and Vio International, the episode explores how genres such as quelbe, calypso, and scratch band music were born from the island’s complex past. Through storytelling, performances, and cultural insight, Naydyeyah reveals how the rhythms of resilience and celebration continue to echo through generations.

programme.title: Small Town, Big Story
programme.sub-title: Small Town Big Story: Where Lobster Is Always On the Menu - Rockland, ME
programme.desc: From lobster lovers to badass lobsterwomen, the charming seaside village of Rockland offers something for everyone—especially during the Rockland Lobster Festival, a delightful combination of games, art, and some of the freshest lobster you'll find anywhere.

programme.title: Small Town, Big Story
programme.sub-title: Small Town Big Story: Man Vs. Train
programme.desc: For over 50 years, bikers from around the world have gathered in Colorado to race the Durango & Silverton Narrow Gauge Railroad Train through the Rocky Mountains, over two mountain passes.

programme.title: Small Town, Big Story
programme.sub-title: Small Town Big Story: Where the Highland Games Come Home - Banner Elk, NC
programme.desc: Just two hours north of Charlotte, Banner Elk offers a wide array of year-around activities for outdoor enthusiasts, but is most well known for their annual Highland Games, one of the largest celebrations of Scottish culture and tradition anywhere in the world.
